Class DES

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.helsinki.fi.desu.DES

  • public class DES
extends java.lang.Object
    Main logic methods for DES encryption.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] feistelF(byte[] R, byte[] K)
      Main Feistel function for structuring block ciphers.
      byte[] feistelS(byte[] input)
      Applies the 8 S-Boxes to the 48 bits of data, resulting in 32 bits of output.

      Generates subkeys for encryption and decryption.

      Returns array containing the initial permutation.

      Returns array containing the inverse initial permutation.

    • Method Detail

      • permute

        public byte[] permute(byte[] input,
             int[] table)
        Method for applying a permutation to an array of bytes. Permutations are done bitwise based on the elements of parameter table.
        Parameters:
        input - input array of bits
        table - table of permutation
        Returns:
        permuted array of bytes

      • feistelF

        public byte[] feistelF(byte[] R,
              byte[] K)
        Main Feistel function for structuring block ciphers.
        Parameters:
        R - array of bytes to
        K - array of subkeys
        Returns:
        substitution-permuted array

      • feistelS

        public byte[] feistelS(byte[] input)
        Applies the 8 S-Boxes to the 48 bits of data, resulting in 32 bits of output.
        Parameters:
        input - original array of 48 bits
        Returns:
        resulting 32 bits of data

      • generateSubkeys

        public byte[][] generateSubkeys(byte[] key)
        Generates subkeys for encryption and decryption.
        Parameters:
        key - original key by which to generate subkeys
        Returns:
        array of subkeys

      • getIP

        public int[] getIP()
        Returns array containing the initial permutation.
        Returns:
        initial permutation array

      • getReverseIP

        public int[] getReverseIP()
        Returns array containing the inverse initial permutation.
        Returns:
        inverse initial permutation array
